The 8 AI Skills That Will Separate Winners From Losers in 2026
Everyone is scared AI will replace them.
You see kids building apps and automations, somehow printing money, while you feel overwhelmed, jealous, and eager all at once.
But you don‚Äôt need to be a tech genius or a coder to win.
You just need these 8 skills to future-proof yourself.
Watch my Youtube for my whiteboard lecture!
To support my free AI education: HIT LIKE + LEAVE COMMENTüôè
Below, I‚Äôve listed the 8 skills with only brief commentary.
Watch the full Youtube video with my whiteboard breakdown!
Phase 1: Mindset
These are 3 foundational skills that will serve you for the rest of your career.
It was hard to choose only 3.
But I‚Äôm 100% confident these 3 skills lay the foundation for EXPONENTIAL GROWTH.
They are NOT specific to AI, by design.
1. Skepticism
Trap: Believing what you hear. This often fuels ‚ÄúShiny Object Syndrome‚Äù where you try every new tool or business model you just heard on Instagram. Jumping ship from vibe coding to automations to whatever Reel you just saw.
Skill: Be skeptical of clickbait engineered hype. Be skeptical of AI generated answers. Be skeptical of expensive paid courses. Be skeptical of gurus who claim you need their special knowledge to succeed.
2. Learn to Love Learning
Trap: Stressed and afraid to learn new things, so when new AI tools come out you feel overwhelmed and resist learning. Putting too much pressure on yourself over making money right now with every thing you do.
Skill: Relax a lot, stop thinking about everything in terms of immediate ROI, stop stressing over falling behind, play with AI tools and HAVE FUN.
3. Learn in Public
Trap: Avoiding posting content because you‚Äôre waiting until you‚Äôve mastered an AI tool/skill, or finished building.
Skill: Share your learnings, wins, and failures online transparently. Even if something fails, you can just say, ‚ÄúI tried this, it didn‚Äôt work, but here‚Äôs what I learned.‚Äù Build your brand and help people who are a few steps behind you. AI makes creating content cheap. Trust is expensive. Become the ‚ÄúAI Person‚Äù in your circle so that opportunities come to you.
Phase 2: AI Foundations
These are foundational skills when using any AI tool.
4. Context Engineering
Concept: The more high-quality information and context about your situation, goals, what you‚Äôve tried, what didn‚Äôt work, data, etc. you give AI, the higher-quality answers you get.
Template: Instead of overly focusing on writing the perfect prompt, focus on providing high-quality context (information) to AI. A simple template I like to use:
You are a top 0.1% expert in FIELD, helping me with TASK
CONTEXT: bullet point list of all my info
CONSTRAINTS: bullet point list of all my constraints
Ask me clarifying questions, one at a time, until you are 95% confident you can complete the task successfully
5. Sparring Partners
Concept: Stop using AI for surface-level answers. Use AI to understand what questions you should‚Äôve been asking.
Action: Tell AI to act as a critic or skeptic. For example, instead of ChatGPT glazing you, ask it, ‚ÄúTear my idea apart and find my blind spots.‚Äù Use multiple LLM models to compare and contrast answers; look for convergence and divergence of answers.
Phase 3: AI Tech Stack
Here are the technical skills you should learn in 2026 to increase your leverage and actually use AI to scale yourself. However, if you‚Äôre still struggling with the previous 5 skills, I recommend spending your time on developing those FIRST.
6. Vibe Coding
What is vibe coding? Building apps in plain English. You no longer need to spend years learning coding syntax to spin up simple sites.
You can build websites, landing pages, calculators, lead magnets, and simple web & mobile apps just by describing them. The key is to keep it SIMPLE, like literally 1 tiny feature, and describe it clearly.
7. AI Systems
There‚Äôs a big difference between chatting manually with ChatGPT vs. having a 24/7 system on autopilot doing work.
For example:
Old Way: Copy/paste a customer support ticket email into ChatGPT, write reply, paste back into Gmail.
New Way: AI system that reads the support ticket, checks your knowledge base, and sends a reply via Gmail.
The reason why I‚Äôm so excited teaching AI, especially to entrepreneurs, is because you can now scale yourself to meaningful income levels, without traditionally hiring a big team or raising capital. You can own your destiny. To be honest, I sleep A LOT better without investors or a Board. But the key is to build AI systems that work while you sleep.
8. Documentation
However, AI Systems fail if they don‚Äôt know the rules. That is, if they don‚Äôt have meaningful or sufficient context.
I chose Documentation as a separate skill because the mileage you get out of AI systems squarely depends on the quality of your documentation. It is the ‚Äúbrain‚Äù powering your AI System. Write clear, step-by-step instructions. Continually update your documentation, as it becomes your competitive advantage.
Think about it this way: ‚ÄúHow would you explain this task to a brand new employee?‚Äù Write that down. That‚Äôs your documentation.
The Formula
The gap between winners and losers isn‚Äôt technical ability.
It comes down to this formula:
AI Leverage = Skills x Clarity
And when it comes to Skills, if you love learning and learn in public, you‚Äôll be able to acquire new skills quickly while building your brand in the process.
You get rewarded for learning (since brand is an asset).
Plus, communicating what you‚Äôve learned helps you learn it better.
The more Skills you have, the more Clarity you have when using AI. You provide better context to AI tools, you have deeper complex sparring sessions, and you make smarter decisions about what AI Systems and Vibe Coded apps are worth building.
Most importantly, use AI to level up YOU.
The more skills you have, the more clarity you will have, and the more leverage you will get out of AI.
